fields.description:

there were also a large number of connections from the UFS:

{code}
# ps aux | grep 'postgres: eucalyptus eucalyptus_shared 10.111.5.81' | wc -l
269
{code}

and some request timeouts, possibly causing retries.
fields.summary: IAM error deleting accounts with high concurrency

comments.body: [~sjones] It appears the issue is the insufficient connections in the db pool due to the slow account deletion. Do we want to change the error message given to the user (i.e., busy service) and prevent retries (from client or UFS)?

[~spark], I think the issue is the way we grow/use connection pools. We may want to catch the connection error and retry for some period of time to allow the connection pool to grow, or it may be possible to simply set the build throttle to the pool size or the maximum expected request concurrency. Alternatively we could limit the number of connections from the pool that could be used by a given component (in this case euare)
[~sjones] Ok then sounds like it's better to target 4.2.1 or 4.3. I'll change the version for now.

Configuration is updated so connection building is not throttled.

Fix Verified.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.3.0
Release     : 0.25004.338.20160622git6b6bd6b.el7
